snippet: A regulator fined 10 of 12 companies a total of $200 million, a record for China. The penalties coincided with deteriorating relations between Tokyo and Beijing.
abstract: Chinese regulators intensify their antitrust scrutiny of multinationals, finding 12 Japanese auto parts and bearings manufacturers guilty of fixing prices charged to Chinese factories of at least five automakers, imposing fines totaling roughly $200 million; fines coincide with deteriorating diplomatic relations between the two countries.
lead_paragraph: A regulator fined 10 of 12 companies a total of $200 million, a record for China. The penalties coincided with deteriorating relations between Tokyo and Beijing.

headline.main: China Fines Japanese Auto Parts and Bearings Makers in Price Rigging
headline.print_headline: China Fines Japanese Auto Parts and Bearings Makers in Price Rigging
